item.title: Research
item.description:
You are a researcher and you have collected a pile of related papers in PDF format. You enjoy Foldie a lot, because in your research documents you include Foldie links to the papers and easily open them from there. Now you want to try the Metadata feature of Foldie.

You think of good paper attributes, such as author, topic, publication-year, quality, cited-paper. You add properties to the links to the papers. You study the inter-linking of papers using the metadata browser and find that a lot of papers cite paper P. Being a good researcher, you really read that paper, think hard and you find a flaw. You write a paper about that and prove 20 other papers wrong. Congratulations!
